text:
47yo homeless male with h/o hepatitis, HCV, and EtOH abuse s/p fall in
   jail on [**8-1**]. Pt was initially at [**Hospital 880**] Hospital where he was noted
   to have hematemesis, was scoped and found to have bleeding esophageal
   varicies s/p 6 bands. The pt was intubated s/p witnessed aspiration
   event at OSH, then was transferred here for further evaluation by our
   GI service. Since admission to [**Hospital1 19**], the pt has been re-scoped with no
   s/s active bleeding. He has received 2 units of PRBCs and his HCT has
   been stable at 30. His MS has been altered since admission to OSH (head
   CT at OSH negative), so he currently remains intubated for airway
   protection. Extubation is pending improvement of mental status. The pt
   also comes to [**Hospital1 **] with elevated white count, bandemia, and fevers. He
   has been pan cultured and is being treated with broad spectrum abx.
   Likely cause of infection at this point thought to be aspiration PNA.
   Gastrointestinal bleed, upper (Melena, GI Bleed, GIB)
   Assessment:
   s/p EGD with placement of 6 bands @ OSH (repeat EGD here showed no s/s
   bleeding). Hct 30.9. Abd soft and distended. +hypo BS noted. Flexiseal
   intact and patent draining liquid brown stool. NGT with no bloody
   returns.
   Action:
   Remains on Protonix and Octreotide gtts. Hct checks [**Hospital1 7**].
   Response:
   Plan:
   Monitor Hct checks [**Hospital1 7**]. Cont on octreotide and protonix gtts.
   Respiratory failure, acute (not ARDS/[**Doctor Last Name 11**])
   Assessment:
   LS rhonchorous throughout. CXR worsening with bilat infiltrates. Desat
   to mid 80
   Action:
   Sxn Q2-3 hrs. Bronch done at bedside by Dr. [**Last Name (STitle) 7375**]. ABG sent and Fio2
   and peep ^
d this shift.
   Response:
   Sxnf or copious amts thick tan/blood tinged secretions via ett. Bronch
   done with copious amts thick plugs. Vanco and Zosyn.
   Plan:
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Opens eyes to stimultation, does not track or follow commands. No
   spontaneous movement noted. Withdraws to painful stimuli in BLE only.
   Cough/gag impaired. +perrla noted (R eye slugghish). No seizure
   activity noted.
   Action:
   Remains on rifaximin and lactulose. Neurology following.
   Response:
   Ongoing neuro assessment.
   Plan:
   Fever (Hyperthermia, Pyrexia, not Fever of Unknown Origin)
   Assessment:
   Temp max 102.3. WBC 26.8. Pan cx
s [**8-4**].
   Action:
   Tylenol given, cool bath and cool cloths applied. BAL sent s/p bronch.
   Broad spectrum abx for empiric coverage for pna/pneumonitis (witnessed
   aspiration).
   Response:
   Temp down to 101.7.
   Plan:
   Monitor temp and fever curve. Plan for daily CXR until extubated. F/u
   cx
